subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Phil Mickelson blew a three-shot lead with seven holes to play but still won the HSBC Champions in Shanghai, beating the Englishmen Ross Fisher and Lee Westwood with a 6-foot birdie putt on the second playoff hole. It was Mickelson’s first win outside the United States in 14 years. Mickelson had a three-stroke lead after 11 holes, but dropped four shots on 12, 13 and 15.
